title: Online Workshop for EdTech Professionals: Language Learning Design-Centered Competency Enhancement with Integrated Text, Vocabulary, and Grammar Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational technology theories, learning experience in language education, basic grammar and vocabulary comprehension, and introductory text analysis in digital environments.
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based language learning environments, utilization of online tools for project collaboration, and digital text analysis (vocabulary frequency analysis, grammar pattern recognition, etc.).

learning_goals: Learners will master 80% or more of core competencies for educational technology specialists (instructional design, project management, language acquisition theory application), with particular emphasis on understanding language acquisition theories and text analysis techniques.

Learners will analyze two or more collaboration scenarios with diverse stakeholders and propose practical language education applications (grammar structuring, vocabulary expansion strategies, digital text utilization).

Learners will implement a project deliverable that integrates 21st-century competencies (critical thinking, digital literacy) into language education design (grammar systems, vocabulary networks, text analysis).

resources: ETCS (European Transfer and Accumulation System) survey tool template
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
